heaviest_rainfall.status: The most intense rainfall recorded took place on 04 January 2025, with precipitation totalling 36.8mm.  The rain fell at 4.6mm per hour at times over the course of the 37.2 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The rain rate reached 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, and resulted in 21.19mm of rain over 15.0 hours.  This is the highest rate recorded by our weather station.

longest_rain.status: A relentless rainstorm took place on 04 January 2025, it lasted 37.2 hours and it delivered 36.8mm of rain at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: Since records began on 11 April 2025, the highest lightning strike count in one day is 23 on 07 September 2025.

storm.status: No storms are expected.  The last storm was observed on 21 September 2025 and continued for 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is currently no cold snap.  This year there have been 6 cold snaps, usually there are 3.7 cold snaps per year.

extreme.status: The maximum temperature difference seen is 26.7°C, observed on 29 April 2025 when the temperature fell to 0.4°C but also managed to reach 27.1°C on the same day.

heatwaves.status: There is not a heatwaves right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 1.9.

tropical.status: The most recent tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and this has only occurred 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (185°), which differs from the daily average south-westerly (233.0°) by approximately 48.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The record wind gust remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

run.status: The largest wind run ever was on 21 October 2012 with a value of 1737 miles.

speed.status: The record wind speed remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 6.1°C), outside temperature (down 6.0°C), and inside temperature (down 2.6°C) and more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 11%).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in light levels (up 9285 lux), cloud levels (up 977 m), and pressure (down 8 mbar).

The past week and month had observable variation in light levels (up 10566 lux) and cloud levels (up 512 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 976.6m lower than yesterday, 173.7m lower than the past week, 512.1m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels yesterday fell between 1104m minimum and 3920m maximum, with an average of 1286.3m; weekly and monthly averages were marginally higher at 1460.0m and 1798.4m.

summary.summary: Inside; comfortable and pleasant temperatures. Outside; cold spells are likely. Also, dry and less humid conditions and calm and still conditions are expected. Drizzle or light rain possible, occasional overcast conditions, and overcast conditions will limit sunlight. The weather will likely remain the same.
